Dear Vincenzo

Congratulation with you work, I assume it has taken quit som=
e time

Now, considdering the effort you have put into coupling cantera int=
o fluent perhaps you would be willing to share that knowledge with me (and =
others)?

I was thinking that you might have a small sample problem, which =
you could distribute? - Fluent case and data files, c-source to the udf tha=
t uses cantera, a sample of a makefile, and maybe a short readme file.

I t=
hink that could be very helpfull to many of us that stroggle with CFD and c=
hemistry modeling in our everyday work.

Thanks in advance - I hope you wil=
l considder the above.

Best regards,
Martin

Dr. Martin S. Skj=F8th-Rasmus=
sen

Departmentof Chemical Enginee=
ring

-----Original Me=
ssage-----
From: vincenzomulone [mailto:vmulone@...] 
Sent: 15. april=
 2004 13:17
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] Re: fluent coupl=
ing: c-c++ linking


Dear all, dear Dave,
I finally succeeded in coupling C=
antera and Fluent, even if I made 
fluent simply call an independent "Cante=
ra using function" 
libhello.cpp.
The problem lied on the linker, so I used=
 g++ instead of ld;
I attach here the most important parts of my src/makefi=
le:

#---------------------------------------------------------------------=

-#
# User modifiable section.
#-------------------------------------------=
--------------------------
-#
SOURCES=3D call.c
FLUENT_INC=3D /usr/local/Fl=
uent.Inc
#location of non-fluent libraries
LIB_DIR =3D /usr/local/lib/cante=
ra
#c++ sources
CXX_SOURCES =3D libhello.cpp
MY_LIB =3D -L$(LIB_DIR) -loneD=
 -lzeroD -ltransport -lconverters \
         -lcantera -lrecipes -lcvode -l=
ctlapack -lctmath -lctblas \
	 -lctcxx  -L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/i386-redhat-linu=
x/3.2\
	 -L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/i386-redhat-linux/3.2/../../.. \
	 -lfrtbegin -=
lg2c -lm -lgcc_s \
                  -lm
CXX=3D g++
CXX_INCLUDES =3D -I/usr=
/local/include/cantera ............................................
OBJECTS=
=3D $(UDFDATA:.c=3D.o) $(SOURCES:.c=3D.o) $(CXX_SOURCES:.cpp=3D.o) 
.......=
.....................................
CFLAGS_LNX86=3D		-fPIC -ansi -Wall -O=

............................................
.c.o:
	@echo "# Compiling $@ =
because of $?"
	@rm -f $*.o
	$(CC) $(CFLAGS) $(INCLUDES) -c $*.c
.cpp.o:
	$=
(CXX) -fPIC -Wall -g -c $< $(CXX_INCLUDES) 
...............................=
.............
$(TARGET): makefile $(UDFDATA) $(OBJECTS)
	@echo "# Linking $=
@ because of $?"
	$(CXX) -g -shared  -Wl,-soname,$@.0 -o $@.0.0 $(OBJECTS) =

(continues the preceding line) $(MY_LIB) -lc
	/sbin/ldconfig -n .
	ln -sf =
$@.0 $@


....and it seems to work ....
Thank you all very much again. Vinc=
enzo.
